Selection of a constant value (using a binary operator)

declarations-map.description: Definition of declarations of a library

maybe_attributes.description: Optional list of attributes of the enum declaration

maybe_unknown_value.description: Unknown member value (present for flexible enums only)

name.description: Fully qualified name of the enum

maybe_attributes.description: Optional list of attributes of the enum member

external-declarations-map.description: Definition of declarations of an external library

offset.description: Offset in bytes at which a member starts

padding.description: Padding in bytes which follows a member

kind.description: Selection of base type as handle type

nullable.description: Flag indicating nullability of handle type

rights.description: Rights that must be present on a handle

resource_identifier.description: Qualified name of handle's resource type

identifier-constant.description: Definition of a constant value (using an identifier)

expression.description: Expression used in source code to define the constant

kind.description: Selection of constant value using an identifier
Selection of base type as identifier type

nullable.description: Flag indicating nullability of identifier type

protocol_transport.description: Transport used by the request protocol

maybe_attributes.description: Optional list of attributes of the protocol declaration

openness.description: Which kinds of unknown interactions the protocol supports

protocol-method.description: Definition of a method or event

has_request.description: Flag indicating that protocol method has a request component. If has_request is true, the method is client-initiated. It may or may not have a payload, which is provided separately in `maybe_request_payload`. For example, `Foo()` is a method where has_request would be true but `maybe_request_payload` would be absent.

has_response.description: Flag indicating that protocol method has a response component. If has_response is true, the method is either a two-way method or a server initiated event, depending on whether it `has_request`. It may or may not have a payload, which is provided separately in `maybe_response_payload`. For example `Foo() -> ()` and `-> Bar()` are methods where `has_response` would be true but `maybe_response_payload` would be absent.

is_composed.description: Flag indicating whether method was composed into this protocol

has_error.description: Flag indicating whether method uses the error syntax. If true, maybe_response_payload will be a single-element struct wrapping the result union, and the response will be further broken down in the  `maybe_response_result_type`, `maybe_response_success_type`, and `maybe_response_err_type` fields.

maybe_attributes.description: Optional list of attributes of the method or event

maybe_response_payload.description: Optional response type. This is the wire form of the response, so if error syntax is used, this is a struct wrapping the result union.

maybe_response_result_type.description: Type of the result union (only present if has_error is true or strict is false)

maybe_response_success_type.description: Type of the success variant of the result union (only present if has_error is true or strict is false)

maybe_response_err_type.description: Type of the error variant of the result union (only present if has_error is true)

ordinal.description: Ordinal number of the protocol method

strict.description: Flag indicating whether the method supports unknown interactions. If false, maybe_response_payload will be a single-element struct wrapping the result union, and the response will be further broken down in the `maybe_response_result_type` and `maybe_response_success_type` fields.

protocol-method-parameter.description: Definition of parameter or return of a method or event

maybe_attributes.description: Optional list of attributes of the method or event parameter

name.description: Name of the parameter or return

type.description: Type of the parameter or return

kind.description: Selection of type as internal type

literal-constant.description: Definition of a constant value (using a literal)

expression.description: Expression used in source code to define the constant

kind.description: Selection of constant value using a literal

literal-value.description: Definition of a literal constant value

expression.description: Original in source constant value, may be a const expression.

column.description: One-based column number, counting in bytes

length.description: Length of the location, counting in bytes

line.description: One-based line number in the file

naming-context.description: A naming context is a list of names, from least specific to most specific, which identifies the use of a layout. For example, in `type Outer = struct { inner struct {}; };`, the context for the innermost struct is ["Outer", "inner"]. Naming contexts are only specified for anonyous layouts.

partial-type-ctor.description: Description of a type in terms of its composition of other type arguments

name.description: Fully qualified name of the type

nullable.description: Flag indicating nullability of the type

kind.description: Selection of base type as primitive type
Selection of base type as request type

nullable.description: Flag indicating nullability of request type

protocol_transport.description: Transport used by the request protocol

maybe_attributes.description: Optional list of attributes of the resource declaration

name.description: Fully qualified name of the resource

maybe_attributes.description: Optional list of attributes of the service declaration
Optional list of service member attributes

kind.description: Selection of base type as string type

maybe_element_count.description: Optional size of string, in bytes

nullable.description: Flag indicating nullability of string type

max_handles.description: Maximum number of handles present in the struct

maybe_attributes.description: Optional list of attributes of the struct declaration

resource.description: True if the struct is a resource type (declared to contain handles)

maybe_attributes.description: Optional list of struct member attributes

maybe_default_value.description: Optional default value for struct member

max_handles.description: Maximum number of handles present in the table

maybe_attributes.description: Optional list of table attributes

resource.description: True if the table is a resource type (may contain handles)

max_out_of_line.description: Maximum size of the out-of-line payload

maybe_attributes.description: Optional list of table member attributes

maybe_default_value.description: Optional default value for table member

reserved.description: Flag indicating that field is reserved

maybe_attributes.description: Optional list of type alias attributes

name.description: Name of a type alias, i.e. the alias

partial_type_ctor.description: Type constructor being aliased, possibly partial

experimental_maybe_from_type_alias.description: If provided, an alias for the corresponding type used in the definition

maybe_attributes.description: Optional list of new-type alias attributes

has_envelope.description: Flag indicating if this declaration contains envelopes (in unions or tables)

has_flexible_envelope.description: Flag indicating if this declaration contains flexible envelopes (in unions or tables)

has_padding.description: Flag indicating if there could be padding bytes in this declaration

inline_size.description: Size of bytes in the inline portion of this declaration

max_handles.description: Maximum number of handles this declaration can hold

max_out_of_line.description: Maximum number of bytes in the out-of-line portion of this declaration

max_handles.description: Maximum number of handles present in the extensible union

maybe_attributes.description: Optional list of extensible union attributes

resource.description: True if the union is a resource type (may contain handles)

union-member.description: Definition of an extensible union member

max_out_of_line.description: Maximum size of the out-of-line payload

maybe_attributes.description: Optional list of extensible union member attributes

ordinal.description: Ordinal value of extensible union member

reserved.description: Flag indicating that the member is reserved

kind.description: Selection of base type as vector type

maybe_element_count.description: Optional number of maximum elements in vector type

nullable.description: Flag indicating nullability of vector type

declaration_order.description: List of declarations in declaration order

declarations.description: List of declarations and their types

enum_declarations.description: List of enumerations, sorted by fully qualified name

experiments.description: List of active experiments given to fidlc via the --experimental flag

experimental_resource_declarations.description: List of resources, sorted by fully qualified name

external_struct_declarations.description: List of external structs that are used to form method payloads, sorted by fully qualified name
